result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Oumar T Bility

records.addlTxt: 10:37 AM Prosecuting attorney Robin W Lee in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant failed to appear. Court issued bench warrant.
Status conference on October 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not be at any Walmart store.
Trial Judge - Br 13

9:24 AM Defendant Oumar T Bility in court.  Prosecuting attorney Thersa Louise Lewandowski in court for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Initial appearance on August 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

11:26 AM Defendant did not appear.  Thersa Louise Lewandowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State unable to provide evidence of sufficient personal service of notice for hearing. Court rescheduled Initial Appearance, State to issue Summons (or other attempt at service).
